The function $f(x)$ satisfies
\[f(x) + f(2x) + f(2 - x) + f(x + 1) = x\]for all real numbers $x.$  Find $f(0).$

Let $P(x)$ be the assertion $f(x) + f(2x) + f(2-x) + f(x+1) = x.$

$P(0) \implies f(0) + f(0) + f(2) + f(1) = 0.$
$P(1) \implies f(1) + f(2) + f(1) + f(2) = 1.$
$P(2) \implies f(2) + f(4) + f(0) + f(3) = 2.$
$P(x) \implies f(x) + f(2x) + f(2-x) + f(x+1) = x.$
$P(2-x) \implies f(2-x) + f(4-2x) + f(2-(2-x)) + f((2-x)+1) = 2-x.$
$f(2-x) + f(4-2x) + f(x) + f(3-x) = 2-x.$
$P(x+1) \implies f(x+1) + f(2x+2) + f(2-(x+1)) + f((x+1)+1) = x+1.$
$f(x+1) + f(2x+2) + f(1-x) + f(x+2) = x+1.$

From $P(0) \implies 2f(0) + f(1) + f(2) = 0.$
From $P(1) \implies 2f(1) + 2f(2) = 1.$
From $P(2) \implies f(2) + f(4) + f(0) + f(3) = 2.$
$P(x) = f(x) + f(2x) + f(2-x) + f(x+1) = x.$

Replacing $x$ by $2-x$ in $P(x)$ gives
\[ f(2-x) + f(2(2-x)) + f(2-(2-x)) + f(2-x+1) = 2-x. \]
\[ f(2-x) + f(4-2x) + f(x) + f(3-x) = 2-x. \]
Let $x = 0$ and $x = 1$.
$P(0): 2f(0) + f(1) + f(2) = 0$.
$P(1): f(1) + f(2) + f(1) + f(2) = 1$, so $2f(1) + 2f(2) = 1$.
$P(2): f(2) + f(4) + f(0) + f(3) = 2$.
$P(x+1): f(x+1) + f(2x+2) + f(1-x) + f(x+2) = x+1$.
Try $f(x) = ax+b$.
$ax+b + 2ax+b + 2a-ax+b + ax+a+b = x.$
$2ax + 2ax - ax + ax + 4b + 2a + b = x.$
$4ax + 4b + 2a = x.$
Comparing coefficients, we get $4a = 1$ and $4b + 2a = 0$.
$a = \frac{1}{4}$, $4b + 2(\frac{1}{4}) = 0$.
$4b = -\frac{1}{2} \implies b = -\frac{1}{8}$.
$f(x) = \frac{1}{4}x - \frac{1}{8}$.
$f(0) = -\frac{1}{8}$.
Final Answer: $\boxed{-\frac{1}{8}}$
